page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content: Housing Edington and Coulston were originally three villages,the eastern part of Edington being Tinhead.Geographically, the houses are still in three groups. The overall impression in all three is a pleasing mixture of ancient and modern,with all types of material used.Of course,the visitor is immediately attracted to the many thatched cottages,these being complemented by many large mansions.Dotted throughout the countryside are numerous farm houses with adjoining farm workers cottages. To complete the picture there is a cul-de-sac of some 40 houses and flats belonging to the local council, most of them being built between the wars.Several of these have been bought from the council during the past 10 years,and improved.
